name: Individual Outpatient Therapy
summary: Weekly one-on-one counseling focused on recovery goals, coping skills, and long-term stability. Sessions are tailored to your needs and schedule.
body:
Individual outpatient therapy offers structured, private counseling while you continue daily responsibilities. Our clinicians collaborate with you to build practical strategies for relapse prevention, emotional regulation, and life balance.

Care plans are reviewed regularly to ensure progress and accountability. You will receive compassionate, evidence-informed support that respects your pace and goals.
expectations: Initial assessment to understand your history and goals
Personalized treatment plan with measurable milestones
Weekly or biweekly sessions based on clinical need
Ongoing coordination with case management when appropriate

faqs.question: How long does outpatient therapy last?
faqs.answer: Length varies by need, but many clients begin with 8-12 weeks and extend as goals evolve.

faqs.question: Can I combine therapy with other services?
faqs.answer: Yes. Therapy can be paired with case management, primary care, or group services.

faqs.question: Is this confidential?
faqs.answer: Yes. Your information is protected by privacy laws and our internal policies.

metaDescription: Individual outpatient therapy with personalized counseling, recovery planning, and flexible scheduling.

name: Comprehensive Clinical Assessment
summary: A full biopsychosocial assessment that clarifies diagnosis, treatment needs, and the right level of care. Includes screening tools and clinical recommendations.
body:
Our comprehensive clinical assessment provides a clear picture of your behavioral health, medical history, and recovery needs. Licensed clinicians use standardized tools and interviews to understand your strengths, risks, and goals.

The outcome is a recommended care plan that can include outpatient therapy, intensive services, or coordination with primary care. Assessments can also support referrals and insurance documentation.
expectations: Detailed intake covering mental health, substance use, and medical history
Validated screening measures and clinical interviews
Review of current medications and prior treatment
Written recommendations for next steps

faqs.question: How long does an assessment take?
faqs.answer: Most assessments take 60-90 minutes, depending on complexity.

faqs.question: Do I need a referral?
faqs.answer: No referral is required. You can self-schedule an assessment.

metaDescription: Comprehensive clinical assessments with evidence-based tools and clear treatment recommendations.

name: SACOT
summary: Substance Abuse Comprehensive Outpatient Treatment (SACOT) delivers structured, multi-week therapy and skills training while you live at home.
body:
SACOT is an intensive, structured outpatient program designed for clients who need more support than standard outpatient care. Services typically include group therapy, individual counseling, and education sessions.

Participants follow a consistent schedule that promotes accountability, recovery skills, and peer support. Our team coordinates care to address mental health, substance use, and life stability.
expectations: Multiple weekly sessions with a consistent schedule
Group and individual therapy focused on recovery skills
Progress reviews and treatment plan adjustments
Coordination with family or support networks when appropriate

faqs.question: Is SACOT the same as inpatient treatment?
faqs.answer: No. SACOT is outpatient care, so you return home after sessions.

faqs.question: How long is the program?
faqs.answer: Duration varies, but many clients participate for 8-16 weeks.

metaDescription: SACOT provides structured outpatient recovery support with therapy, education, and accountability.

name: SAIOP
summary: Substance Abuse Intensive Outpatient Program (SAIOP) offers focused therapy and education several times per week for sustained recovery.
body:
SAIOP is designed for individuals who need intensive support while maintaining work, school, or family responsibilities. Programming includes group therapy, relapse prevention, and skill-building sessions.

Our clinicians tailor the plan to your needs and help you build a strong recovery foundation. We coordinate care with other services as needed.
expectations: Structured weekly schedule with multiple sessions
Evidence-based group therapy and education
Individual check-ins to monitor progress
Relapse prevention planning and life skills coaching

faqs.question: Who is a good fit for SAIOP?
faqs.answer: Individuals who need more support than standard outpatient therapy but not residential care.

faqs.question: Can I work while in SAIOP?
faqs.answer: Yes. Sessions are scheduled to support work and family commitments.

metaDescription: SAIOP delivers intensive outpatient care with therapy, education, and relapse prevention tools.

name: Case Management
summary: Coordinated support for housing, employment, transportation, benefits, and other stability needs that strengthen recovery.
body:
Case management helps you navigate the practical challenges that impact recovery. Our team connects you with community resources, social services, and long-term support.

We work alongside your clinical providers to ensure your care plan addresses real-life barriers. This service is especially helpful during transitions or after higher levels of care.
expectations: Needs assessment and resource mapping
Coordination with community partners
Assistance with appointments and paperwork
Ongoing check-ins to track progress

faqs.question: Does case management replace therapy?
faqs.answer: No. It complements therapy by focusing on practical stability needs.

faqs.question: Can family members be involved?
faqs.answer: Yes, with your consent, we can include supportive family members.

metaDescription: Case management connects you to housing, benefits, and community resources to support recovery.

name: Primary Care
summary: Integrated primary care services to address physical health, chronic conditions, and preventive needs alongside recovery care.
body:
Primary care services help you manage overall wellness as part of recovery. We provide routine checkups, medication management, and preventive screenings.

Our clinicians coordinate with behavioral health providers to deliver whole-person care. This integrated approach improves outcomes and supports long-term stability.
expectations: Medical history review and wellness screening
Ongoing medication monitoring as needed
Preventive care and health education
Coordination with behavioral health services

faqs.question: Do I need to be in treatment to use primary care?
faqs.answer: Not necessarily. Primary care is available based on eligibility and scheduling.

faqs.question: Will you coordinate with my existing doctor?
faqs.answer: Yes, with your permission we can coordinate care plans.

metaDescription: Primary care services integrated with recovery support to address physical health and wellness.

name: DWI Services
summary: Education and intervention services designed to meet DWI requirements while supporting safer decision-making and recovery.
body:
DWI services include assessment, education, and support to help participants meet legal requirements and reduce risk. Our team delivers structured sessions focused on accountability, substance use education, and behavior change.

We also connect participants with additional treatment resources when indicated. The goal is to promote safer choices and long-term wellness.
expectations: Screening to determine appropriate education level
Structured classes covering risk reduction
Completion documentation provided when requirements are met
Referrals to additional services if needed

faqs.question: Will I receive proof of completion?
faqs.answer: Yes. Documentation is provided after requirements are fulfilled.

faqs.question: Are these classes confidential?
faqs.answer: Yes, we follow privacy standards while meeting reporting requirements.

metaDescription: DWI services with education, assessment, and documentation to meet requirements and support recovery.

name: Payment Options / Accepted Insurance
summary: Clear information on self-pay options, insurance verification, and payment plans to help you start care quickly.
body:
We offer flexible payment options and work with many insurance plans to reduce barriers to care. Our team can verify benefits, explain coverage, and review potential out-of-pocket costs.

If you are paying out of pocket, we can discuss payment plans and available assistance. The goal is to make treatment accessible and transparent.
expectations: Insurance verification and benefit review
Transparent cost estimates when available
Self-pay options and payment planning
Guidance on paperwork and approvals

faqs.question: Which insurance plans do you accept?
faqs.answer: Coverage varies. Contact us to verify your specific plan.

faqs.question: Can I start services before insurance is verified?
faqs.answer: In many cases, yes. We will explain any financial responsibilities.

metaDescription: Payment options and accepted insurance guidance with transparent cost support.
